DOC.brief_summary: This study tested the effectiveness of computer-assisted screening for identifying patients at risk of intimate partner violence (IPV) in a Canadian family practice. It was hypothesized that the use of computer-assisted screening among female patients would lead to higher rates of IPV discussion-opportunity and IPV detection during medical consultations, compared to patients receiving standard medical care.
DOC.brief_title: Computer-assisted Screening for Intimate Partner Violence in Family Practice
DOC.criteria: woman at least 18 years of age visiting one of the participant physicians in a current or recent intimate relationship during the last 12 months having the ability to speak and read English and give consent visiting a provider other than the regular family physician new patient previously approached for the study very sick had a dual appointment (herself and accompanied dependent)
